content.description: Step on to a dike and follow bolts up to a chain anchor.
Start is same as Unnamed#1 but below bulge place a small cam and head up and left clipping a couple of bolts.
Face climb up to the base of a flared slot.  A carefully-placed #5 C4 will protect moves until better pro can be gained.
Up the face to a left-leaning crack.  Follow the crack then up the face to finish.
Climb the right-hand of two cracks. The crack doglegs to the right near the top.
content.protection: Cams and nuts to fist size. Excellent horizontal crack above and behind the top allows for anchors. No bolts.
content.location: Located on the low-angle east face of north rock. The corner of the east face and north face is a rounded, grid-bolted arete (see photo). To the left of that arete is a chimney and to the left of the chimney an excellent mixed trad and bolt route. Lose the Ego is on the face about 40 feet left of the latter.

climbs.name: Eyes That Lie
climbs.fa: Mark Leonard, Paul Horak, David Baltz

content.description: This is a great warmup for Surface Tension. A committing couple of moves off a dike gain the very high first bolt , followed by some increasingly thin face/friction to the top.
content.protection: 3 draws and a couple of 2" - 3" cams for the belay.
content.location: At the far right end of the North Wall, before the easy scramble descent.  Three bolts diagonalling right identify the route.

content.description: Climb the left of two cracks. A steep start leads to easy jamming with face holds. The crux is near the top as you move right into a seam with tricky gear placements. Finish on easy face climbing.
content.protection: Mixed cams and nuts. Nothing larger than hand size required. About 15 feet back from the top of this route is an excellent horizontal crack for placing anchors. No bolts. You can belay from the top (or top-rope) and walk off easily to the south.
content.location: Located on the low-angle east face of north rock. The corner of the east face and north face is a rounded, grid-bolted arete (see photo). To the left of that arete is a chimney and to the left of the chimney an excellent mixed trad and bolt route. Explosive Testimony is on the face about 40 feet left of the latter.

content.description: Step off the deck to a series of dikes/ledges that lead off left in the direction of the chickenheads.  Move up the chickenheads clipping three bolts then step right and clip the last bolt.  The crux is the last move.
content.protection: Four bolts.  Take some medium cams for the belay.
content.location: Thirty feet left of Eyes That Lie.  Look for a vertical dike with some shallow chickenheads.

content.description: North Rock is, as the name implies, furthest to the north. When TP gets crowded, North Rock is the place to find solitude.
